data.text:
Tour the Museum

General Admission: $12 adult / $6 youth (5-17)

The museum is open Wednesday - Saturday from 1-4pm (closures are noted on the museum calendar on the home page of this site). You may want to allow about an hour to enjoy the museum. Volunteer docents are here to greet you and provide an overview of the museum and share some of the fascinating history of the building, art and furniture or let you discover the museum at your own pace. Feel free to ask questions!

Private and Group Tours

Group tours, field trips, and specialty tours with a focused topic are available by advance appointment. Contact us to find out more at 765-742-6449 during office hours, Monday-Friday 10am-5pm.

Accessibility

The Haan Museum is proud to announce that our historic mansion house features an accessibility ramp alongside the steps to the main entrance and a newly remodeled elevator certified to carry up to 750 pounds.

The belief that anyone should be able to experience the best of Indiana art in an unforgettable setting fuels the Haan Museum’s dedication to maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for all.

If you have any questions or concerns regarding accessibility when visiting the Haan, please call (765) 742-6449.

Museum Rules

No smoking, vaping, use of tobacco products of any kind, or illegal drugs is permitted in the museum or on the grounds.

Visitors should be dressed appropriately; shirt and shoes are required.

Children under the age of 8 are to be accompanied by a responsible care giver at all times.

No firearms or other weapons may be brought on the grounds unless they are part of an exhibit or permitted under state law.

Anyone purposely damaging or attempting to damage Museum property will be asked to leave, and may be subject to arrest or other legal action.

No dogs or pets allowed inside the museum building. We welcome leashed dogs on the grounds and in the Sculpture Garden. Please clean up any mess and leave the property free of any animal waste or damage.
